Text: Press ReleaseDCGSTS PR doc Attached is the press release announcing the open season of the storage and pipeline project Please visit the website and try to attend one of the shipper meetings being held next week in either Houston or PHX The meeting schedules are at The Derek from to Houston Galleria at The Four Seasons from to Houston Downtown at The Pointe South Mountain PHX There will also be a meeting in San Diego on I look forward to seeing you at one of the meetings and discussing the project with you

Michelles poemThanks for dinner last night I enjoyed talking with you and meeting Eric Here is the poem you requested Paranoid Do you really care what I have to say Are you going to end up ignoring me anyway Should I sit here like a statue in stone Do I really like feeling so alone What did I do to the world to feel this way Why am I so paranoid everyday My mind lives in a constant shade of black I always want to run and pack To find a world thats all my own Somewhere I can finally call home But the fear remains with me Its all I can see Why does everybody stare Or even glare They say its all in my head Its like Im a ghost back from the dead Its scary to be left alone Even inside my own home Everyones out to get me All after me Now when you ask me whats wrong It takes me too long To figure out What the questions about Do you really care what I have to say Are you going to end up ignoring me anyway Should I sit here like a statue in stone Do I really like feeling so alone MICHELLE MCVICKER

RE Details of Meetings in Phoenix Cc In case there was any confusion should that be anymore confusion we are meeting next week in Phoenix See you all then EOC I need to give a final count to the hotel so if you havent RSVP please do so today Diane McVicker Principal Analyst Salt River Project Original Message From REEVES GLEN D Sent Friday August AM To Cervin Pete MCVICKER DIANE B PElectriccom PRICE KENT A Keeler Paul PElectriccom PElectriccom REEVES GLEN D Cc EWMcom KOENIG JANICE Subject RE Details of Meetings in Phoenix Diane is out today but I will commit us on her behalf to the original schedule Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday August PM To PElectriccom Lindh Frank Law Armato John P PElectriccom PElectriccom Subject Details of Meetings in Phoenix Importance High SRP would will host days of settlement discussions in Phoenix The schedule is EOC pm at the Hilton Phoenix Airport S th St The following one and onehalf days for all the shippers will be at the PERA club E Continental Drive Tempe AZ Those meetings are scheduled as follows pm noon There is no mass transit system in Phoenix so you will need to rent a car to get from your hotels to the PERA club A list of hotels and a map to the PERA club are attached If you need more help let me know airport to PERAhtm east valley hotelsdoc I look forward to seeing you in September Diane McVicker Principal Analyst Salt River Project

Update on the EPNG events of Cc Hi everyone Sorry for the delay in responding to all the messages and emails regarding the meetings sponsored by SRP There were a few people who were in Phoenix before the WTC disaster and we did meet on Wednesday to do some brainstorming This email is an attempt to share the discussions with those of you who were not here The parties who met were SRP APS PD SWG SoCal and the ACC Joel Greene Barbara Jost Kelly Daly and Dave Huard were here as legal counsel and Greg Lander was here as a consultant There are no new proposals on the table We did discuss ways to get to a point where we might be able to talk settlement and whether or not parties might be willing to turn back capacity No surprise that we keep coming back to what do you use to allocate the existing capacity Greg is going to run some numbers for the EOC based on different starting scenarios using the assumption that CD capacity will be made available at some level He will also be looking at the impact of seasonalizing the EOC loads SRP will reschedule the meetings or arrange a conference call to discuss settlement once we have Gregs analysis I wouldnt expect anything before the end of September unless it is a conference call Thanks to everyone for letting me know your status during the week It was a relief to know everyone was safe somewhere Diane McVicker Principal Analyst Salt River Project
